caption.center: STATE of Missouri, Respondent, v. Lyle M. SCHOOLFIELD, Appellant.

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Western District.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court of Ray County, The Honorable Kevin L. Walden, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
Craig A. Johnston, Columbia, MO, for appellant.
Shaun J. Mackelprang and Mary H. Moore, Jefferson City, MO, for respondent.Page 834
opinion.panel: Before: JOSEPH M. ELLIS, P.J., and ALOK AHUJA and KAREN KING MITCHELL, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text: Lyle M. Schoolfield was convicted in the Circuit Court of Ray County of one count of sale of a controlled substance, two counts of possession of a controlled substance with the intent to distribute, two counts of possession of a controlled substance, and one count of possession of drug paraphernalia with the intent to deliver or sell. On appeal, Schoolfield challenges the sufficiency of the evidence on each count. We affirm. Because a published opinion would have no precedential value, a memorandum setting forth the reasons for this order has been provided to the parties. Rule 30.25(b).
